name: Learn Basic Music Fundamentals
description: Understand core music theory concepts including note names, basic rhythm (whole, half, quarter notes), time signatures, and the layout of the piano keyboard.

name: Master Proper Posture and Hand Position
description: Learn and consistently practice the correct sitting posture, hand shape, and finger placement at the piano to develop good habits and prevent strain.

name: Practice Basic Finger Exercises and Scales
description: Develop finger strength, dexterity, and independence by practicing fundamental exercises like five-finger patterns, C major scale, and simple arpeggios.

name: Learn to Read Sheet Music
description: Understand how to read notes in both the treble and bass clefs, recognize key signatures, accidentals, and various note and rest values to interpret written music.

name: Learn Your First Simple Pieces
description: Apply newly acquired skills by learning and playing several very simple pieces or exercises, focusing on rhythm, note accuracy, and basic musicality.

name: Establish a Consistent Practice Routine
description: Develop and commit to a regular daily or near-daily practice schedule, ensuring consistency is maintained for continued progress and skill development.

name: Explore Chords and Basic Chord Progressions
description: Understand how to form major and minor chords, learn common chord progressions (e.g., I-IV-V-I), and begin to use them to accompany simple melodies or play pop songs.

name: Learn Intermediate Pieces and Techniques
description: Expand repertoire by learning more complex pieces that introduce new techniques, rhythms, and musical expressions, working on dynamics, articulation, and pedaling.

name: Research and Acquire Piano/Keyboard
description: Investigate different types of pianos or keyboards (acoustic, digital, weighted keys), set a budget, and acquire a suitable instrument along with essential accessories like a bench, stand, and metronome.
